title: [Energy Fighter] Reina, the Boisterous Disciple
body:
**Appearance**
Reina is a boisterous and hot-blooded 5th member of Team Ninja (who also, incidentally, revokes Akali's status as "token girl ninja"). This champ was based off of that thread a while back asking about a boisterous and large-ham-y ninja like Bang Shishigami. She wields sai, and her sleeveless ninja robe reveals well-defined arm muscles. Her attacks tend to have a flaming flair to them, her arm ignites whenever she gets a critical, etc...

**Lore (not entirely content with, please send help)**
Reina was recruited into the Kinkou from an early age. During an attack by raiders, her small home village was entirely destroyed, and her parents killed. The Kinkou sent assistance as soon as they knew what was going on, but the attack was too fast. The Kinkou treated her as a permanent guest, as a way of rectifying their failure. For the first few years, Reina was given a simple, relaxing stay in a Kinkou temple, no requirements but to sweep the floors and help prepare the food, but quickly Reina decided she wanted more. Hiding behind pillars and practicing the martial-arts techniques the masters taught, and staying up until the crack of dawn running laps through the halls. She proved to have not only great determination and force of will, but talent, too. Eventually, the masters decided to make her a fully fledged student, but still, her thirst to prove her worth remained unquenched. After finally becoming a master herself, at a fairly young age, she entered the League of Legends to show off her talent, passion, and flair for fighting and glory.

**Stats**
HP: 420 (+90)
HP/5: 4.25 (+0.55)
Energy: 200
Energy/5: 50
AD: 48 (+3.4)
AS: 0.651 (+2.5%)
AR: 19 (+4)
MR: 30 (+0)
MS: 340
Range: 125

**Passive: Hot Blooded**
Every time Reina hits a target with an ability or attack (excluding from items), her cooldowns decrease by 1 seconds, and she gains 30 energy. This ability cannot be triggered on the same target more than once every 5 seconds, and this effect is halved against minions. 

**Q: Ancient Seal / Ninja Dash**
Reina throws a seal at a target location. Enemies struck by the seal activate her passive, but have no other effect. The seal remains, and every time Reina enters it, she gets a buff to MR and Armor for a few seconds. Up to 3 seals may be in the game at a time.

If this ability is cast on an existing seal, Reina dashes to it, dealing physical damage to every enemy she hits. (Because of the cooldown, you need to plan ahead, place a seal, wait, then dash to it)

Cooldown: 5 seconds
Energy Cost: 0 to place a seal, 70 to dash
Seal Silence Duration: 1 second
Seal Diameter: 125
Projectile Speed: Roughly the same as Galio's Resolute Smite
Dash Damage: 30/45/60/75/90+80% AD
MR and Armor buff: 15/20/25/30/35+25% bonus AD
Buff duration: 2 seconds

**W: Blazing Rushdown**
Reina's attack speed and movespeed increase sharply for a very short duration.
Energy Cost: 80
Duration: 1.5 seconds
Attack Speed Boost: 35/45/55/65/75%
Movespeed Boost: 30/35/40/45/50%
Cooldown: 6 seconds after effect ends.

**E: Energetic Strike**
Reina dashes through a target in melee range, knocking them up and dealing physical damage. This ability applies on-hit effects.
Cooldown: 11 seconds
Energy Cost: 90
Range: 150
Total dash length: 300
Knockup Duration: 0.5 seconds
Damage: 0/25/50/75/100+120% AD

**R: Flaming Fists of Fury**
Reina does a slow leap through the air, dealing magical AoE damage where she lands. Enemies struck are slowed, and Reina gets a flaming shield that scales off her max HP and adds flat bonus damage to her spells and attacks as long as it exists.
Range: 425
AoE radius: 100
Airtime: 0.75 seconds
Magical Damage: 100/225/350+150% AD
Slow amount: 25/35/45%
Slow Duration: 1.5 seconds
Shield amount: 25/30/35% of Max HP
Maximum Duration: 7 seconds
AA boost: 30/40/50 Damage
Spell Boost: 60/80/100 Damage
Cooldown: 210/195/170 seconds (keep in mind, it benefits from her passive)



**Quotes**

Champion Selection:
[#] I'm going to prove my strength to everyone!

Moving:
[#] They're toast!
[#] The tables have turned! Reina is here!
[#} Don't underestimate my strength!
[#} I'll have them crying in fear!

Attacking:
[#] Surrender, or feel my fists!
[#] My fist, your face, we're making it happen!
[#] When I'm done, they won't recognize you!

Death:
[#] Not bad, that was a great fight!

Taunt:
[#] I'll finish you all off in under 5 seconds!

Ultimate:
[#] Feel my Fiery Fists of Fury!

replies.body:
I know a Reina... I think you may have just summoned her IRL...

*steps back from portal*
I'm going to prove my strength to everyone!
wow, not one, but two reds? I'm honored, haha!

Your concept has my name. It was very strange to come across.


I don't have as much commentary on your kit itself, though I would like to mention that it's difficult to read out the purpose and goals behind each ability.
To scope that to a specific ability, as an example, I would say that it's difficult to figure out why the kit has the silence area since it reads as inconsistent. Is there a specific play pattern you wish to accomplish with this, or a specific use case you want this to setup? Is the inconsistency important? These are questions that were difficult to try to read out of it.

This same message can be considered a reply to Daen, who said sorta the same thing.  Before you posted that comment, I had actually removed the silence area effect, something I figured shoulda been removed anyways.

Her general idea is supposed to be a mobile bruiser-y fighter like Wukong. As for that situational energy recharge thing, there is something that needs pointing out: the costs of her abilities. In order for her to use all 3 abilities, she would need more energy than she has. If she wants to use em all, she'll NEED to be working her passive, which is weaker against minions. There is a different purpose for every attack, though.
Her Q gives her some mobility, but with the need for preperation, and some defensive potential. Her W is her moneymaker, her greatest source of damage, and an excuse to build pure AD as opposed to AD and AS, while her E is a good followup to outmaneuver her opponent. Finally, her R has it all. While lacking the damage of other AD ults, she gets a shield AND a buff, and because of the AoE she basically can refresh all of her cooldowns if she uses it to initiate. If you have any suggestions, though, I'll be happy to hear em.

Some hypothetical play patterns include:
Using her Q to get close to an opponent, W to chase them down as they flee, and then E as a way to duck to the other side of them and prevent their escape.
When attacked, drop Q on self, E to start the fight, then W to finish the job. If it turns out to be too hot to handle, she can dash back to the seal she placed earlier and W or even R to run away.
If she's seperated from a team fight, in trouble, and needs to escape, she can R straight into the teamfight, get some shielding, cooldown refreshes, and energy to be prepared to help finish the fight and not die, assuming some health has been built on her, of course.
You've got a point. This kit has nothing that ties it together, no interaction. It's kind of like the current Sion in my opinion.

Does it interest you that this was born out of a desire to see an expy of [BANG SHISHIGAMI](http://blazblue.wikia.com/wiki/Bang_Shishigami)?
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KvXEprUZdy4

NOTE: This is gonna seem kinda douchebaggy of me to say this, and please believe me when I say that I really do mean this with the most honest of intentions and not because I'm a dream-crushing troll. I try my best to be a good summoner and a generally nice and supportive person in most endeavors...

...but I don't really see this working without some serious edits, either conceptually or systematically for a few reasons (I'm not gonna touch the lore since it's not really fair to judge a character entirely by something as potentially fluid as their lore).

1.) Standing silences. For the most part, champions have been trending away from status effects as utterly stifling as silences. Why? *Lack of engaging counterplay.* Regardless of if you're an ADC and you're putting out the deeps for days, those abilities of yours are still important for that little extra burst to secure kills and end fights quickly. Silencing, even for a DPS character, is like slicing off at least 25% of your damage for a couple of seconds, which is really bad. For ability based characters, double or even triple that percentage. It's like being in a waking nightmare.

http://i.imgur.com/g4HSUpL.jpg
*Yep, like this guy's. Yes, I did just go there.*

Your character is proposing to have an ability that could, more or less, chain silences together along with having the same mobility as Vi. That's just a little bit nuts. Maybe you could try swapping out the type of CC for something else, perhaps a slow or something. Either way, though, the cooldown needs to go up pretty substantially. And speaking of cooldowns...

2.) The passive. Not only is that a HUGE energy gain, regardless of having to switch targets, but most of the cooldowns on this champion are so short that you'll never run out of either cooldowns or resources unless you never basic attack anything between ability uses, which is rare. It's very possible with just what I've mentioned here, you might be able to do some tweaking and make things a bit more reasonable. I'd honestly like to see the end result.

3.) His/her personality. To be perfectly honest, while the abilities of the ninja in League of Legends, more or less, aren't very sneaky, the Kinkou, and especially the Triumvirate, stress balance in all things. An incredibly boisterous, fight-happy brawler wouldn't really fit that picture of balance that they're looking for. If anything, this character is more likely to be allied with Zed, as their intense passion would fall more in line with his drive towards a single personality aspect or goal.

Those are just a few things that I noticed. Hopefully, this feedback might provide some ideas for further refining this concept.

Also, please check out my Energy-based ADC/AD Caster with his unique Shadow Possession ability: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/BxIn84WU-champion-concept-valruk-the-jungles-revenge

You're right about, I guess, all of these points.
I was waiting for someone to comment on the Silence on the seal, figured it might have been too much for her kit (I mean, a 125 Diameter AoE IS really hard to hit with. I figure it'll just proc her passive and have a slightly larger AoE)
The passive IS only half-strength for minions. That DOES make it harder to fully regain energy from. On the other hand, maybe I should bump up her cooldowns and energy costs a bit, especially the cooldown on conflagration.
As for the personality, well I'm keeping that for sure, but you are right that it seems out of place for a Kinkou ninja, but at the same time I don't see her as a flat-out villain. Her origins DEFINITELY need to be tied into their order, but hey, I was complaining already that her Lore felt kinda flat. If we can figure out a good in-between for her Lore, that'd be nice.

Perhaps you could just have her be a Kinkou dropout or something like that. It's not like there isn't any middle ground. Lee Sin is an Energy champ, but he bears no allegiance to the Kinkou and is still a good guy. Remember that Energy really represents the transcendence achieved through martial training, used to harness inherent abilities. Once you realize that, it's not super difficult to come up with lore that would make that work.

I like it but I don't know if being *Hot-Headed* is a quality that would be best for a ninja. She'd have no common ground with any of the others. I'd like her to be light-hearted but also wants to prove herself to her piers. Apperantly she's trying her best and wishes to be as strong as they are. I say light-hearted to give us more sympathy by making a run-on to the story telling how she will look onward towards a better future. And wishes to bring Zed back to his senses. (They could have had a relationship but that's up to you.)

I have a ninja-turtle who'd disagree with your first sentence.
As for bringing Zed back to his senses, she'd be more the type to bring him to justice.

I see Mikey as a light-hearted guy as well.
And Raf is a serious guy.
I haven't seen them be hot-headed but I have seen them bicker as siblings would.

Leo's the serious turtle. Raphael is definitely hot-headed.
Either way, though, Reina's not so much hot-headed (that implies full of anger and rage, and the only reasoning behind her ult's name is the alliteration), but rather hot-blooded (aka cheesy shounen anime protagonist)
oh, then why don't you just say she has a anger deep inside of her. and you don't want to be around when it is revealed. its like a trigger.
take a look at her story, man, it's ALL about hot-bloodedness, not hot-headedness. Her current lore is basically she became a really good ninja through sheer force of will and passion for the art.

ah, like kennen, only with a more hard core life. i also don't want everyone to hate zed... the guys a misguided personification of what not to do when you get power. he also didn't do nothing to really hurt her from what her lore says.

I wouldn't call it hate. With her current lore, she'd be more the type to bring him to justice because it feels like the right thing to do.

Though, if her lore is changed because her hot-bloodedness is too much for the poor zen kinkou people, she might have a sort of respect for Zed, instead. A sort of "Wow this guy's tough! I deeply admire the effort it must have taken him to go so far! I wanna fight him!"
–and then they have a growing love/hate relationship.

Quick thing:

>W: Conflagration

Brand already has an ability called Conflagration.  I recommend trying to grab a name for the ability that hasn't yet been used.
---
Generally speaking, what is your goal for this champion?  What adjectives would you use to describe her, what sort of role do you envision her taking, and what niche would you like her to fill?
---
Most energy champions have a situational modifier on their energy recharge.  Allowing the champion to refresh energy on any ability or autoattack goes against that design philosophy a bit, and allowing her to attain 30 energy from every single attack (albeit, switching targets) means she would effectively never run out of energy in the right circumstances.  In that situation, why use energy as the resource?

Thanks for the tip on the ability name, it's a shame, conflagration was such a cool name for this ability.
Maybe "Fire it Up?" "Blazing Rushdown?" I'll go with the latter.

Very nice, but 30 energy per hit via her passive is way too much. Change it to 15 Energy, but the whole effect (CDs and Energy restore) doubles when you hit Champions. Adds more skill requirement, and encourages aggression.

Good skill concepts, but balance could be tweaked.

The idea was there to help with laning. Did you miss the "This ability cannot be triggered on the same target more than once every 5 seconds. " part? I mean, if you didn't, I'd still be willing to change it.

Then again, maybe that WOULD be a better idea, Reina's personality is supposed to be aggressive.

I saw that, but you didn't specify if it can proc off minions or if it's Champions-only. If it can proc on minions, Reina just has to spread attacks between minions and she regains all her energy in seconds. If it's Champions-only, then your version is balanced, but needs clarification.
Yes, it can proc off minions. So yeah, I'll lower the energy regain.
I'd like some feedback on her lore, ideas to change it up a bit. It's just something simple I pulled out my rear end for this post.
